title: Apple’s four-pack of AirTags drops to $75
content:
Macworld

If you’re forgetful and a bit disorganized, finding your keys in the morning can be a nightmare. If you get a bunch of AirTags, however, you can solve that problem, and today, they’re on sale for a near-all-time low: A four-pack of AirTags is only $75 at Amazon right now, a savings of $24 on its $99 MSRP and just $18.50 per AirTag.

Now, these round little tags are super useful not just to wear on your keyring (with an accessory), but also to pop into your bag or backpack, to add to your luggage, and so on. When the tags are within Bluetooth range, you can check their exact location on your phone and even make them ring. You can also use them the other way around and press on the AirTag button to make your phone ring when you’ve misplaced it. When the AirTag is out of range, it will ping off other iPhones or iPads, so you get a relative location for them.

We’ve reviewed the AirTags and found them worthy of a 4-star rating, loving their design and size, as well as the fact that they have removable batteries that are easy to swap out. So snag your very own four-pack of Apple AirTags for $75 while this deal still stands.
